definition[0]: a machine for removing air that is hot or smells unpleasant from a kitchen, factory etc
definition[1]: a machine that removes dirt, dust etc from the air
example[0]: a steam extractor that fits neatly into the ceiling
example[1]: By not having extractor fans weâ€™re breaking Health and Safety regulations.
definition[2]: a company that removes RAW MATERIALs, such as gold or oil, from a place, for example the sea or the ground, and sells them to companies which use them in an industrial or manufacturing process
example[2]: Many Third World countries are the extractors of raw materials rather than being the refiners or processors of them.
definition[3]: software that finds and retrieves (=gets back) information that has been stored in the memory of a computer, on a website etc
example[3]: An email extractor can extract e-mail addresses from web-pages on the Internet.
